name: Days Inn Wilmington Market Street

reviews.text: Good rate at this hotel. The room was clean, with the exception of brewed coffee still in the coffee pot (I don't use the in-room coffee makers anyways). Nice LG flatscreen, microwave and fridge.
reviews.title: Just okay for me

reviews.text: I could see daylight coming in under and from the sides of the door to the exterior which allowed plenty of sound to come in from the exterior ...car doors shutting, cars driving up, I could easily hear the conversations of people talking outside. I would recommend getting a room on the top floor to cut down on some of this. I'd probably stay there again for the rate.
reviews.title: Fall Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel last May, so we decided to stay there again. Once again, we were very pleased. This is a great hotel for the cost. The room was clean, the bathroom was spotless, coffee and condiments were delivered every day as were fresh towels, etc. The room was quiet. We like this hotel because it is in a great location. It allows easy access to many restaurants, attractions, beaches, etc. There are several restaurants and stores within walking distance. There is an on-site restaurant. We ate dinner there one evening. The food is reasonably priced, but we found that it was not very tasty. We tried breakfast and enjoyed the breakfast menu. We plan to stay here again when we visit the Wilmington area again.
reviews.title: a/c was lacking somewhat

reviews.text: stayed for 2 nights. had a problem with key card and had to get replacement (had locked the 'working' one in the room). had a problem with toilet flushing at 2am, front desk brought a plunger w/in a few minutes of call. other than that, no problems. there were some loud neighbors and we traveled w/ pets. at 3am dogs will bark when something loud wakes them up, so we tried keeping them quiet but it was hard a time or 2! parking lot VERY well lit at 2am as well. reserved a 2 bed, but told them I would take a 1 bed if necessary due to pets and availability. room was large enough for 2 large crates and still had room. bathroom was clean. a/c was on heat when we came in and it really didnt cool down as much as I'd like, except at night. we left it on high cool all day and it wasnt any cooler when we returned than when we left. were in room 239 facing pool and setting sun. overall nice place, quiet, good access to restaurants, etc.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: I usually stay at nicer hotels, but since it was summer at the beach, I didn't want to spend an arm and a leg. I was pleasantly surprised with the Days Inn Wilmington. My room was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and went above and beyond to get me the room I wanted. The motel is pet friendly so I was able to bring my dog with me. The only complaint was there were some rowdy guests outside our room, but the manager was prompt in taking care of before I ever needed to complain. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Very clean room, friendly staff, excellent value for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its just down the street from the beach and in a great area! If you're not staying in a beach front hotel here in Wilmington, bring a lot of quarters! The room was okay...nothing special. The service and front desk staff were okay. We had a lot of problems with the card keys and the pool was dirty. This is a really cheap place! You get what you pay for!
reviews.title: It was okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm not normally a fan of Days Inn - some of their properties are decent (for an "economy" hotel) and some of them are downright frightful. All other things being equal, I'd call this a good, not great, Days Inn. The real draw, however, is the low price - lower than a typcial DI. Their street sign proudly trumpets "Best Value". Our rate was only about $4 more per night than the scary rock-bottom motels a mile or two down the road. I would consider it $4 well spent.
reviews.title: Best property you can get at this price point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was smooth and pleasant. The staff was friendly and helpful. Another guest had problems getting the internet on his laptop and I saw the manager helping him out. Location was decent - lots of eating options in the vicinity and a safe neighborhood (down the road is another story, however).
reviews.title: Better than you might expect

reviews.text: This is an older property which is currently undergoing renovations as of Jan 2012. Several of the rooms are shutdown for the upgrades. I imagine they'll be finished in time for the summer beach rush. We got one of the upgraded rooms, so everything in the room was still "sparkling". Our room had new carpets, new drapes, new bath fixtures, a new 36-inch flat-screen TV, new vanity, new shower curtain, and a new curved shower rod (which could have been hung better).
reviews.title: great pet friendly option/ ok hotel room

reviews.text: The toilet was definitely "original equipment". It was an old 5 GPF beast that has seen better days. The caulking around the base of the toilet was not very good. I can't tell how good the maintenance here is since most of the stuff in the room was new, but the sloppy caulking was not a good sign. Water was hot and we had plenty of it.
reviews.title: Well worth the money

reviews.text: So, I took a couple days to do some stuff in Wilmington, NC and the best bang for my buck and near where I was going seemed to be the Days Inn. I only stayed one night, but I have to say I was impressed. Check-In was very simple and easy, and the lady who checked me in was VERY helpful and very nice. My room was right next to the pool. So there was a little bit of noise up until 9, but I loved my view of the pool. The room had a bit of a smell to it, but that was my only complaint. A ton of TV channels, though some were doubles. Bathroom was really tiny, but the bed was a good size.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Impressed

reviews.text: The shower head was very odd. It felt like someone took a fire house and was just pouring it on me. It felt very good when washing my hair, but stung my body. It didn't look like there was anywhere to adjust the settings either.
reviews.title: Nicely maintained older hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had bought a microwavable meal for myself but forgot a fork. I went to the check in desk, and the restaurant gave me plastic fork and spoon. Thought that was very nice.
reviews.title: Got the job done

reviews.text: Nice restaurant, but I didn't eat there so I can't comment on the food.
reviews.title: Nice enough

reviews.text: I had a working sink, shower, microwave, TV, and fridge. I stayed for a night & I was very satisfied.
reviews.title: Dirty Carpets

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel, along with 10 others, during April 2012 as part of a 17 day road trip across GA, NC, SC. By giving the star rating I am not saying the hotel is a 3 star but whether it was clean and value for the money and to an extent we have compared then to the other 10 hotels we stayed at.
reviews.title: No included breakfast

reviews.text: This was the motel type where your room door opens onto the car park and maybe is not as safe as a traditional hotel. On the other hand you can park directly outside your room and just be careful. The public areas where quite noisy in the evening but calmed down before midnight.
reviews.title: Clean and friendly!

reviews.text: Our room, 147, had 2 double beds and was clean & tidy with a good TV.
reviews.title: Nice Older Hotel - 2nd Visit
Good until...
reviews.text: This was the only place in our tour that did not have an included breakfast. My fault for not reading the details correctly. There was a restaurant attached but this added another $15 to the stay. Personally I preferred the self service breakfast rather than this waited on service, and the food was not any better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was quite expensive for a Days Inn when you consider the room at £42 plus the extra for breakfast but it was still a good choice and I would most probably stay again. Only 3 stars as there is better value about.
reviews.title: Not our first choice

aka: Days Inn Wilmington Market Street Hotel
